Article.Abstract: Paramyosin and Sm14 are two of the six antigens selected by the World Health Organization as candidates to compose a subunit vaccine against schistosomiasis. Both antigens are recognized by individuals naturally resistant to Schistosoma mansoni infection and induced protective immunity in the murine model. Three Sm14 epitopes and eleven paramyosin epitopes were selected by their ability to bind to different HLA-DR molecules using the TEPITOPE computer program, and these peptides were synthetically produced. The cellular recognition of Sm14 and paramyosin epitopes by peripheral blood mononuclear cells of individuals living in endemic area for schistosomiasis was tested by T cell proliferation assay. Among all Sm14 and paramyosin epitopes studied, Sm14-3 was preferentially recognized by individuals naturally resistant to S. mansoni infection while Para-5 was preferentially recognized by individuals resistant to reinfection. These two peptides represent promising antigens to be used in an experimental vaccine against schistosomiasis, since their preferential recognition by resistant individuals suggest their involvement in the induction of protective immunity.
Article.ArticleTitle: Identification of immunodominant epitopes of Schistosoma mansoni vaccine candidate antigens using human T cells.
Article.Affiliations: Departmento de Bioquímica e Imunologia, Instituto de Investigação em Imunologia-Instituto do Milênio, Universidade Federal de Minas Gerais, Av. Antonio Carlos 6627, 31270-901 Belo Horizonte, MG, Brazil.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMCs were also obtained for this assay from uninfected individuals in the endemic area, from individuals that had been treated for schistosomiasis and then remained resistant to infection, and from individuals that had been treated for schistosomiasis but had become reinfected. Uninfected individuals in endemic areas for Schistosomiasis are presumed to have been exposed to infection but are resistant to it.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: PBMCs from naturally resistant, resistant after treatment, infected, and reinfected individuals did not have significant proliferative responses to this epitope.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMCs were also obtained for this assay from uninfected individuals in the endemic area, from individuals that had been treated for schistosomiasis and then remained resistant to infection, and from individuals that had been treated for schistosomiasis but had become reinfected. Uninfected individuals in endemic areas for Schistosomiasis are presumed to have been exposed to infection but are resistant to it.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: PBMCs from naturally resistant, infected, and reinfected individuals did not have significant proliferative responses to this epitope. Though a weak proliferative response was seen from PBMCs that were resistant to reinfection, it was not significantly different from the other responses.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMCs were also obtained for this assay from individuals that had been treated for schistosomiasis and then remained resistant to infection, and from individuals that had been treated for schistosomiasis but had become reinfected.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: PBMCs from infected or reinfected individuals, or from individuals resistant to reinfection after treatment did not have significant proliferative responses to this epitope.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Environmental exposure to endemic/ubiquitous agent without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Uninfected individuals in endemic areas for Schistosomiasis are presumed to have been exposed to infection but are resistant to it.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMCs were also obtained for this assay from uninfected individuals in the endemic area (exposed but naturally resistant to infection) and from individuals that had been treated for schistosomiasis and were reinfected.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: PBMCs from infected, reinfected, or naturally resistant individuals had lower proliferative responses to this epitope than those who were resistant to reinfection after treatment.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMCs were obtained from individuals that had been treated for schistosomiasis and then remained resistant to reinfection.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: PBMCs from individuals that were resistant to reinfection after treatment had significantly higher proliferative responses to this epitope in comparison to infected, reinfected, or naturally resistant individuals.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMCs were also obtained for this assay from individuals that had been treated for schistosomiasis and remained resistant to infection, and from treated individuals that had become reinfected.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: PBMCs from infected individuals had significantly higher proliferative responses to this epitope then PBMCs from naturally resistant individuals. PBMCs from individuals that were reinfected or that were treated and resistant to reinfection also gave positive proliferative responses.
